name: BCI Competition IV Dataset 2a
citation: Tangermann, M., Müller, K.R., Aertsen, A., Birbaumer, N., Braun, C., Brunner, C., Leeb, R., Meinicke, P., Miller, K.J., Müller-Putz, G.R., Nolte, G., Pfurtscheller, G., Preissl, H., Schalk, G., Schlögl, A., Vidaurre, C., Waldert, S., & Blankertz, B. (2012). Review of the BCI competition IV. Frontiers in neuroscience, 6, 55.
purpose: Motor imagery classification for brain-computer interfaces
description: The BCI Competition IV Dataset 2a consists of EEG recordings from nine subjects performing four different motor imagery tasks: left hand, right hand, both feet, and tongue. The dataset was designed to evaluate and compare different classification algorithms for motor imagery-based brain-computer interfaces.

data_format.data_structure: Continuous EEG recordings with event markers

evaluation_metrics.baseline_methods: Common spatial patterns (CSP), Linear discriminant analysis (LDA)
evaluation_metrics.expected_performance: 60-90% accuracy depending on subject and method

usage_notes.common_applications: Motor imagery classification, BCI algorithm development
usage_notes.limitations: Limited to 9 subjects, no feedback, fixed experimental protocol

paper_relevance.suitability_for_fractional_methods: High - motor imagery involves non-local temporal dynamics
paper_relevance.expected_improvement: Fractional methods may capture long-range temporal dependencies
paper_relevance.validation_approach: Subject-specific cross-validation with statistical significance testing
